subject: RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?
msgSnippet: Take a look at the security machinations that Java demands the classloader undergo on behalf of the virtual machine. I would say that if JUnit can t complete
messageBody:
RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?

Take a look at the security machinations that Java demands the classloader undergo on behalf of the virtual machine.

I would say that if JUnit can't complete some very fundamental piece of its business because the authors made bad design decisions regarding the classloader, you'd need to get someone to go back and refactor JUnit.

Perhaps someone should have tested JUnit with some test software before rolling it out.

    -----Original Message-----
    From:   Fergus Gallagher [SMTP:Fergus.Gallagher@...]
    Sent:   Tuesday, March 27, 2001 3:12 AM
    To:     junit@yahoogroups.com
    Subject:        RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?

    For interest I get exactly the same linkage error on
    org.w3c.dom.Document.  What's so special about that class that it should
    cause the  same error in two different apps.  Can't be coincidence.

    I even tried rebuilding my app from a full set of source files (including
    dom source).

    The problem with the -noloading is that one can't rerun individual test
    cases after a rebuild :-(

    Fergus



    At 19:02 26/03/2001 -0500, you wrote:
    >yes, getTargetException() prints...
    >java.lang.LinkageError: Class org/w3c/dom/Document violates loader
    >constraints - Class org/w3c/dom/Document violates loader constraints
    >
    >yes, the noloading switch solved the problem.
    >
    >thank you for the help.
    >
    >a couple of followup questions...
    >1) Without using a junit.properties file, can the noloading switch be used
    >when calling junit.swingui.main from within the code?
    >2) Is there javadoc info on the TestRunners?
    >-----Original Message-----
    >From: Herrick, Chuck [mailto:chuck.herrick@...]
    >Sent: Monday, March 26, 2001 6:34 PM
    >To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
    >Subject: RE: [junit] cannot run testing with UI TestRunner?
    >
    > From the Javadocs at <http://www.java.sun.com>http://www.java.sun.com
    >         InvocationTargetException is a checked exception that wraps an
    > exception thrown by an invoked method or constructor
    >You can send getTargetException() to this Exception. Give it a try, and
    >see what
    >         System.err.println(getTargetException()) ; reveals. I suspect it
    > will be java.lang.LinkageError.
    >
    >I suspect your problem might disappear if you use the commandline switch
    >-noloading. Why?
    >See below in your stack where it says:
    >         Class org/w3c/dom/Document violates loader constraints
    >-----Original Message-----  From:   Andy Kriger
    >[SMTP:akriger@...]  Sent:   Monday, March 26, 2001 5:22
    >PM  To:     JUnit (E-mail)  Subject:        [junit] cannot run testing
    >with UI TestRunner?
    >
    >This is the output of a TestCase I am running. I get an
    >InnvocationTargetException when I use either awtui.TestRunner or
    >swingui.TestRunner. If I use textui.TestRunner, I have no problems and my
    >TestCase executes as expected. Does anyone have any idea what would allow
    >textui.TestRunner to work and cause swingui.TestRunner to fail? I realize
    >this output is a little vague since I am not detailing the workings of the
    >code, but I am hoping that those working are not relevant since the
    >TestRunner does work in text-only mode and not in UI-mode. The basic
    >goings-on here are that a ProxySubsystem is being started using reflection
    >to load various parts and it fails on the part called FameProxy only when
    >using a graphical TestRunner. C:\dev\weblogic>java -Djava.compiler=NONE
    >com.triene.data.proxy.MasterProxyTest ProxySubsystem INFO  - Started
    >CalculatorProxy in 180ms ProxySubsystem INFO  - Started DataItemReference
    >in 3395ms unable to invoke method start on com.triene.data.proxy.FameProxy
    >because of java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
    >java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException: java.lang.LinkageError: Class
    >org/w3c/dom/Document violates loader constraints         at
    >com.fame.timeiq.enterprise.connections.FameConnectionPoolFactory.<init>(FameConnectionPoolFactory.java)
    >at
    >com.fame.timeiq.enterprise.connections.FameConnectionPoolFactory.createPool(FameConnectionPoolFactory.java)
    >at com.triene.data.fameaccess.FamePool.<init>(FamePool.java:85)         at
    >com.triene.data.proxy.FameProxy.start(FameProxy.java:131)         at
    >java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Native Method)         at
    >com.triene.data.proxy.ProxySubsystem.startService(ProxySubsystem.java:175)
    >at
    >com.triene.data.proxy.ProxySubsystem.startServices(ProxySubsystem.java:157)
    >at
    >com.triene.data.proxy.ProxySubsystem.startSubsystem(ProxySubsystem.java:85)
    >at
    >com.triene.data.proxy.MasterProxyTest.setUp(MasterProxyTest.java:64)
    >at junit.framework.TestCase.runBare(TestCase.java:128)         at
    >junit.framework.TestResult$1.protect(TestResult.java:106)         at
    >junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)         at
    >junit.framework.TestResult.run(TestResult.java:109)         at
    >junit.framework.TestCase.run(TestCase.java:121)         at
    >junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest(TestSuite.java:157)         at
    >junit.framework.TestSuite.run(TestSuite.java:152)         at
    >junit.awtui.TestRunner$10.run(TestRunner.java:396) ProxySubsystem INFO  -
    >Started FameProxy in 1122ms ProxySubsystem INFO  - Started MasterProxy in
    >80ms  Andy Kriger Triene Inc. 1776 Broadway Suite 400 New York, NY 10019
    >646.695.8611 (W) 646.298.5493 (M)  Yahoo! Groups Sponsor
